alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 9:47PM MST until January 06 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow continuing. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 6 to 12 inches, with local amounts up to 15 inches possible near the core of the heaviest snow bands south of Wheatland. Slight lower amounts near the Colorado border. Wind chills as low as minus 20 degrees. * WHERE...Much of southeast Wyoming including, Wheatland, Torrington, Chugwater, Cheyenne, and Pine Bluffs. This also includes Interstate 80 between Cheyenne and Laramie. The most likely area for snowfall amounts exceeding one foot extends from near Wheatland and Chugwater in southern Platte County southeastward into far southwestern Goshen and northern Laramie counties NOT including Cheyenne. * WHEN...until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
